resources.string: You want to clear all list of files

You can select files which would be deleted after entering fake password here. In this menu you can choose only files which don\'t require root rights for deletion.

\n

To add new file or folder, tap button +. 

\n

You can delete file from list, clear list of files or edit file\'s priority. Files with higher priority (lower number of priority) are deleted first. Don\'t forget to enable files deletion by clicking on enable icon in top bar!
Do you want to clear logs?
Logs for day %1$s would be cleared.

You can read logs here if they are enabled. You can find out when application was unlocked and what files were deleted. Logs are deleting automatically after 7 days, but you can change this behaviour.
Enter timeout for logs autodeletion (in days)
Logs older than n days would be cleared to free space.
Do you really want to enable logging? If adversary would get access to application password he can get data about deleted files. It is highly recommended to enable logs only for application testing.
Do you want to disable logging?

Android AntiForensic Tools is a free and open-source app designed to protect your personal data from a powerful adversary who can put pressure on you and force you to unlock your device. It allows you to delete user profiles and personal files when a fake password is entered, a USB device connected or the wrong password is entered several times. An app provides additional options to protect your device from being researched by advanced adversaries: it can uninstall itself, run TRIM after data deletion to prevent deleted data recovery, disable logs before data deletion to leave no traces of it\'s actions and disable safe boot mode.

Read more on GitHub.

You can support me with Monero: 88Z5fsVK6FP4oVNjo2BrHydAEa5Y1gTPi5d7BN68sjVDZ9dTn8wPb89WmUxrxf3T37bRGSR5dekkU9aQ7j8ErWcBJ2GZojC

Special thanks to:

x13a, the developer of the Wasted app which inspired me to create this app.

iamr0s, the developer of the Dhizuku application.                

BinTianqi, the developer of the Owndroid app, who wrote the code to connect to the Dhizuku service.
Do you want ot enable deletion?

If you activate triggers, selected files would be deleted.

\n

Important: files deletion doesn\'t work in BFU mode. If you enter duress password in BFU mode, files deletion will be launched after phone unlocking. If you set up app to destroy itself, it will destroy itself only when all files will be deleted. That\'s why it\'s recommended to avoid using this mode and delete profile with your secret files instead if you can grant app enough privileges.

Enter your new password. It should not be shorter than 8 characters. Try to make it strong and similar to your device\'s password to be able to claim that you typed a duress password accidentally due to a typo.

You can change user settings here.

Some settings depend on your threat model!

  • If you think that you may be targeted by hackers, or you think you won\'t be in trouble if your adversary finds out that your app deleted your data, avoid granting root rights to this application, because root makes your device less safe against some exploits. Without root, the possibilities of an app would be limited, though some advanced functions are available with Dhizuku. You can set up an app to wipe the whole device, or to delete some user data and hide itself from the launcher.
  • If, alternatively, you are only wary of having your device searched and in your situation an obvious deletion of data from your device could put you in danger, then grant the app root privileges. In that case, I advise you to set up deletion of your secondary user profile and enable all possible options: stop logd, run TRIM, uninstall itself. The app will stop logd, delete your profile, start TRIM to make data unrecoverable and finally uninstall itself. Complete self-destruction may take several seconds, so try to not provide the correct password to an adversary too fast.

Follow the tips listed below regardless of the threat model! 

  • Use all triggers (duress password, USB connection, bruteforce, power button). Data destruction will start on activation of one of these triggers. Each of them protects you from different types of attacks.
  • Set up a strong password and make it similar to your device\'s password to be able to claim that you typed a duress password accidentally due to a typo.
  • Disable safe boot mode or make this app a system app if you can. Safe boot mode may be used to circumvent the protection offered by this app. However, disabling safe boot mode may raise suspicions.
  • If you set up this app to delete data in the specified user profile, disable UI for switching between users when you doesn\'t need it, because otherwise an adversary may use the pull-down settings menu to get a list of your profiles from the lockscreen.
  • If you set up this app to delete data in the specified user profile, install this app in this user profile too and set up an app to wipe data on all triggers.
  • Make sure the app is working and data deletion with app uninstallation doesn\'t take too long. You can use logs to do some tests. Test before use! Test after updating the app! If something is wrong, please create an issue on GitHub and show logs. You can also find detailed description of all apps functions on GitHub.
Folder %1$s deleted: %2$s percents of files removed
Folder %1$s is not deleted: %2$s percents of files deleted.
You denied access to files, it may cause some bugs.
The app uses accessibility service to listen for a duress password on the lockscreen and listen for usb connections.
This app requires accessibility service for various actions. Click \"ok\" and go to \"Installed Services>Android AntiForensic Tools\" if you want to enable/disable accessibility service.

This application needs admin rights to be able to:

  • Wipe device data
  • Observe wrong password attempts

Press "ok" and then press "Activate" to grant this application admin rights.
Device admin rights are not enough to perform operations.
Device admin action failed for some reason: %1$s
Device owner action failed for some reason: %1$s
Root action failed for some reason: %1$s
Wrong android version, SDK version %1$s or higher required
Select maximum number of wrong password attempts before clearing the data. Enabling this option will protect device against bruteforce. Default number: 10

After completion of all operations app will run TRIM command and tell the drive about all areas of data are no longer being used and therefore can be erased. Enabling this option may reduce the likelihood of deleted data recovery. Requires root rights.
App will wipe all user\'s data or all data on device if called from main user. For wiping all device data (calling wipe from main user) with device admin rights Android 13 or below required.

App will destroy itself after ending of all operations. Requires root rights or Dhizuku permission. 

\n

Warning: self-destruction may take several seconds to complete, avoid providing correct password to adversary too fast after trigger activation.<\strong><\p>\n

Important: its recommended to use this option with root privileges. If you use this option with Dhizuku permission, Android system may display notification about app deletion that will make data deletion obvious for adversary. Consider using “clear & hide” option with Dhizuku.

App will start to destroy data when usb device or usb accessory connected. Connecting device to computer in charging only mode will be counted too. This option will protect you from attacks. Don\'t forget to disable this option if you want to connect any USB device without losing data! Requires running accessibility service.
After reaching maximum number of wrong password attempts (default: 5), app will start to destroy your data. Requires device admin rights.
Visit your root manager to revoke root rights for this app
There you can select profiles for deletion or create new ones. Don\'t forget to enable profiles deletion by clicking on enable icon in top bar!
All profiles marked for deletion will be deleted if you activate some trigger
Do you want to install dhizuku?
You need to install dhizuku app and give it device owner rights
You need superuser rights to be able to manage profiles

Do you want to disable logd service on device boot? It will prevent adversary from using logs data to get history of data destructive actions. Logd will be enabled on device reboot when you will disable this option or delete the app. Requires root rights.

Do you want to disable logd service after starting deletion of your data? It will prevent adversary from using logs data to get history of data destructive actions. Logd will be enabled on device reboot. Requires root rights.
Multiuser settings are not found on this device.
It seems like your device does not support multiple users. If you have root rights, you can enable multiuser UI in settings tab.
Requires root or dhizuku, root recommended

App will hide itself after end of all operations. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

\n

Important: if used without root, this option just hides app from launcher, but app remains visible in settings! This option is incompatible with device admin rights if used with dhizuku rights.
You can set users limit in this dialog. Creating too much users may overflow your device memory.
You can open users settings now
Device can\'t be booted in safe mode now
The same password will be used as a duress password. Try to make it similar to device password.
App will start to destroy your data when you enter duress password - the same password you use to unlock this app. Requires running accessibility service.
Device can be booted in safe mode now
User switcher status was not changed
UI for user switching was disabled too
User switch status was not changed

Safe boot is disabled. Do you really want to enable safe boot? Adversary may use safe boot to circumvent device protection offered by the app. However, disabling safe boot may raise suspicions. Try to make Android AntiForensic Tools a system app instead of manipulating safe boot settings.

Safe boot is enabled. Do you really want to disable safe boot? Adversary may use safe boot to circumvent device protection offered by the app. However, disabling safe boot may raise suspicions. Try to make Android AntiForensic Tools a system app instead of manipulating safe boot settings.
Multiuser UI is enabled. Do you want to disable?
Multiuser UI is disabled. Do you want to enable?

User switcher UI is enabled. Do you want to disable? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.

User switcher UI is disabled. Do you want to enable? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.

Switching user is prohibited. Do you want to allow and enable UI for switching between users? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.\nImportant: use this method only if enabling user switcher UI option didn\'t work.

Switching user is allowed. Do you want to prohibit and disable UI for switching between users? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.\nImportant: use this method only if disabling user switcher UI option didn\'t work.
If you activate trigger, these commands will be started.
You need root rights to run root commands

App will clear itself after ending of all operations. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

\n

Important: app will remain installed on device! This option is incompatible with device admin rights if used with dhizuku rights.

App will clear it\'s data after end of all operations. After clearing app\'s data app can only hide itself (see \"Hide itself option\"). In contrast with \"Clear itself\" option, app\'s permissions will be left intact.
Setup max latency between clicks in one sequence of clicks (in milliseconds). Default: 1000ms.
Setup number of power button clicks in row for launching data destruction
Destroy data on power button clicks?
If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s power off button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data. Requires accessibility service.
If you activate this option, the device will reboot on usb connection, thus entering BFU mode and making it more difficult to hack the device. Requires root or dhizuku.
You need to provide root or dhizuku rights to enable this function
Do you want to grant root rights?

App needs root rights to perform the most restricted operations - for example, uninstall itself silently.

\n

Warning: granting root rights make the data destruction much more stealthy, but unlocking the bootloader and rooting your device can make it less secure against attacks by advanced hackers. If you think that you may be targeted by ones or you don\'t really need stealthy data deletion, then don\'t grant root permissions to the app. If, however, you are only wary of having your device searched and in your situation an obvious deletion of data from your device could put you in danger, then grant the app root privileges and configure it to stealthily delete your data.
